subject: Art & Design
title: Design Systems: Components at Scale
description: A 60-second lesson on Design Systems: Components at Scale.

hook.text: Airbnb's design system has pre-built buttons, cards, and layouts. Designers don't redesign â€” they assemble.

buildup.text: A design system is a collection of reusable components, patterns, and guidelines for building consistent products.

discovery.text: It includes atoms (buttons, colors), molecules (search bars), organisms (headers), and templates.

twist.text: Building a design system is expensive upfront. But it pays off exponentially as products and teams scale.

punchline.text: A design system doesn't constrain creativity.

quiz.question: What is 'atomic design' in the context of design systems?
options: Building from small components (atoms) up to complex templates
